content: I forgot what the steps are, that we agreed on, in case someone new without commit right wants to submit a PR against the core spec and needs someone to review it. Could someone again explain it again please?
I've added a fix for FHIR-22709 and FHIR-20210. Would be happy if it gets merged.

I forgot what the steps are, that we agreed on, in case someone new without commit right wants to submit a PR against the core spec and needs someone to review it. Could someone again explain it again please?

I believe that would be to fork the spec, and create a PR from your fork.
Thanks, I meant after having done that. It was discussed on a call a while back. Not sure where to ping someone with commit rights. There’s #FHIR-I/committers, but not doesn’t seem to be much in use.
The two links above are for the GitHub PRs.
I usually put an @-reference in the comments to the PR to bring someone's attention to it.
